I would take the apple because of its flavor. I tend to choose foods that are sweet and juicy.        Not only that but I'm not exactly fond of bananas. I have had some moments where bananas have had seeds that I choked on. Although apples do have seeds, you know that you should expect to find at least one seed in them. Its unusual for a banana to have seeds.         This is not the only feature of bananas that i dislike. I am very picky about bananas. They must not be too ripe but they can't be too unripe. Apples are the opposite. I could feast on any type of apple with ease.        Then you have bruises. An apples bruise to me, don't really affect taste, but a bananas bruises affect not only the skin and the looks, but the taste. It gives out an unpleasant taste and even though some people prefer it like that, I cannot bring myself to consume it.         Lastly, an apple is just easier to eat. You can't eat the skin of a banana but you can eat the skin of an apple. There are many ways that you can eat the main form of an apple. You can peel its skin off, cut it into slices, or enjoy it with salt.          In my opinion apples are way better than bananas, from their looks to their flavor.

Iâ€™ll take the Apple, my reason is I have hated bananas since I was about three. I actually used to love them so much, when I was a baby. However, I grew up, and matured. I noticed all of the flaws in the seemingly perfect fruit. Itâ€™s mushy texture is disgusting, it tastes bad, and it smells bad. Soon after my epiphany, I cut all contact, and most of my exposure with bananas. However, apples are quite different. They taste and smell pleasant, and I have fond memories with the fruit. I remember, the first pie I ever made for thanksgiving by myself was an apple pie. It was so delicious, and I was so proud of myself. My dad is very passionate about pies and making them. He took a bite of my apple pie, and told me it was perfect. Now when I bite into an apple, it brings back that memories of my fatherâ€™s approval, and making something I was very proud of. So, yes I will choose the apple, due to the sheer juxtaposition of my memories with apples, versus my memories with bananas.

Justice says "the soul that sins shall die" - if we break one in thought/word/deed it's as if we're guilty of all of them. Quite simply, living by the law (which is doing everything perfectly) is impossible for sinful humans   . The law shows us that 1. We will die in Hell if we fail to follow it and 2. We cannot save ourselves BUT, 3. God's perfect, immovable law points us to Christ, who followed and fulfilled the law in thought, word and deed perfectly in our place. He did what we couldn't and did it on our behalf. He was then sentenced to death on a cross, and took our personal punishment for our sin, paying our penalty (like paying our fine) completely FOR us, and has given us freedom.   If we turn from the sins we have committed and repent (pursue the opposite direction of love through Christ) He will, overtime, recreate us back into that previously perfect image through The Holy Spirit which Jesus sends to all who accept Him as their personal Lord and Savior of their life. He will help us through the struggle, the stress, and anything we experience in the world. It's about letting Christ in to guide and teach you and obeying Him through His power (not ourselves, we need Him to help us as it's impossible without depending on His power and instruction).   He is our substitute in His life, death and resurrection. He essentially rewrote history in our place so that, if you believe in Him, it will be as if you had never sinned if you accept Christ's death as our own in our place.   He is in Heaven right now preparing a place for us so that He can take His faithful, believing children home with Him when He returns. He will ressurrect us from death when He returns, giving mercy to those who accept His love, instruction and teachings in their life, and give justice to those who refuse it.   He doesn't want ANY of us to go to Hell and die for continuing in evil and rejecting His way to life, thats why He died FOR us. Hes giving EVERYONE a chance, He wants everyone to take the free gift of salvation from Hell. He wants us to be His and begin to follow His life of love and service through His power and abiding (staying) with Him. So long as we keep our hearts near to Christ through His strength, strive to follow His will of perfect love revealed in the Bible, and let Him lead in the midst of (very certain) pitfalls and struggles, we will, in time, win the ultimate victory over sin, pain and DEATH through Christ. Even if you are willing to be made willing, pray for Jesus to come in and He will do what we can't. Give us The Holy Spirit who will guide us in the right way.   NOTE: You are NEVER too sinful or messed up that God cannot turn your life around through Jesus. EVER. Regardless of what you've done or what you're going through you CAN make it through Jesus.   If you have any questions let me know.

"I'll take the apple" "Why" "Because apples contain a high amount of vitamin C. This is a powerful natural antioxidant that can help boost your bodyâ€™s resistance to both infectious agents and damage caused by free radicals. Each time you eat an apple, youâ€™ll get a healthy dose of this important vitamin.  B-complex vitamins are also found in apples. This includes riboflavin, thiamin and vitamin B-6, all of which are essential in maintaining red blood cells and keeping your nervous system strong and healthy.  Apples include vitamin K as well. This vitamin helps to make proteins, which strengthens your bones and encourages normal blood clotting.   Vitamin E is found in smaller amounts in apples compared to these other vitamins. However, this vitamin does contribute to healthier skin and a stronger immune system.  Nutrients Your Body Needs  Besides vitamins, apples are filled with lots of healthy nutrients. Here are some of the other nutritional benefits you get from eating apples:  Dietary fiber: Dietary fiber is a key component of apples and is actually a type of carbohydrate. Best known for helping to prevent and relieve constipation, dietary fiber is great for keeping you â€œregular.â€ However, it offers a number of other important health benefits. It helps you to maintain a healthy weight, lowers cholesterols levels and can reduce your risk of heart disease, diabetes and some types of cancer. Keep in mind that most of the fiber is found in the apple peel, so leave the peel on to enjoy these health benefits.  Phytonutrients: Apples also include lots of phytonutrients. These polyphenolic compounds function as antioxidants that can protect against damage from free radicals. In addition, they can provide anti-inflammatory effects and enhance your immune system.   Minerals: When you eat apples, youâ€™ll get a boost of important minerals like calcium, potassium and phosphorus. These minerals are required by the body in order to perform various functions, like strengthening your bones (calcium), building muscle (potassium) and filtering out waste (phosphorus)."

Bananas can be used as a scale to compare radioactivity. This is a very interesting fact even without mentioning the other note-worthy characteristics of your average banana joe. In this paragraph, I will layout possible personal preferences and situations that might allow you to compare and pick the better fruit, wether it be a banana or an apple. Firstly, a banana is sweeter than an apple, although some certain bananas are not as sweet as an apple, while being soft and relatively easy to chew. It's also easier to peel a banana; You might prefer to eat unpeeled Apples out of convinience but that is a considerable risk is certain countries, like the one I'm currently in, even with a vigorous rinse. Secondly, with a very biased and ill-informed view, we could see that apples are usually associated with academia and pompous pricks walking while reading a book in campus. Compare that to the relatability of Bananas. Due to the invention of refrigiration, bananas could now be enjoyed throughout the lands and all aspects of society. It's history and affordability as paved way to a banana loving world. From a dock worker in the 1800's, to the certain pompous pricks that has become a business pseudo-para mitilaristic cunt taking advantage of the dock workers, we can all enjoy a quick snack that is healthy and filled with blistering nutrition. Finally, bananas are great for assasinations. Imagine this: Let's say that you wanted to kill a business man. Well, all you need to do is to discreetly hide a banana peel by the docks and wait for that little devil, with his head up high with pride, chewing down his bitter red ball, to fail to see his yellow doom, leading him to slip, fall, and bash his skull open. You can finally leave your insufferable work and travel the carribean with his wife, which bed you've made warm after years of callous but compassionate sex. Together, you shall ride the waves as banana pirates. That ends my paragraph essay thing.

I would choose the apple. Do to the fact that I enjoy the sadisfying crunch I get from biting down on it's bright red skin, and the sweet juices the follow soon after that makes you have to go back to the same spot to drink the liquid golden juices from it. Also because unlike bananas, I would have a much easier time planting a apple tree in a back yard than a tree that grows bananas. Yes the work we'll be long and hard, but in the end I well have my on little apple tree that I can eat the apples that I had upon worked so hard on. And every time I bite down on that big, crunchy apple full of those delicious juices inside. And it well taste ten times sweeter. I also like apples over bananas, is do to the color state of said fruits For example: If I was to ask for a red banana, people would think I'm crazy. But if I was to ask for a red apple, it would be common. But even if I was to ask about a yellow banana, people would say, "Aren't bananas normally yellow". Do to the fact that they are indeed normally yellow, but you are still able to upon ask for a yellow apple, it would also be normal since apples come in yellow as well and is commonly known for that as well.

"Id like the apple please" "Why?" "Ahem. Well you see, Me personally, I prefer the taste and texture of an apple over that of a Banana. You see, in my experience I've had quite a few bananas, most of which have had squishy parts to it. Now it's fair to say I could've avoided eaten said parts, but I am incredibly stupid, so I eat them anyways. That is most more rare in an apple, as most apples are nice, juicy and hard. It's pretty obvious to see what condition an Apple is in, usually squishy parts are brown or easily recognized, where it can sometimes be harder with a Banana. Besides, as I am a lazy bitch, having to go through the work and peel the banana, is simply too much for me. I like the ability to get straight into my snack, and eat it all, which you can with apples, with the exception of a stem, which isn't much. Apples tend to have more juice in them, hence the popular existence of apple juice, while Banana juice is rather unorthodox and different. Having a more juicy and wet snack is ideal in a fruit, as it give them a more natural and fresh feel to them, at least to me. Now I'm aware there are tons of variety when it comes to Banana kind and taste, but nothing is quite as wide as Apples. You can go from candy sweet, to nice and sour. It quite frankly amazing. It can help satisfy any sort of craving I might have, when it concerns fruit. One pro for Bananas, are how they are closely related to Monke, a clear superior species to us pathetic humans. On the contrary, Bananas are also closely related to dicks. However I've found sticking a banana up your ass is much more difficult then say, a cucumber, meaning Bananas would symbolize a dick being sucked, but I can't do that, that's Gay as fuck. Although don't have much if any relation to dick or sex, they are a nice snack to enjoy while being penetrated by a cucumber.  In Conclusion, for me personally, I find apples have more positives in terms of taste, texture and variety than Bananas do. Although this might be different for  other people this is my own response."         "oh, okay cool"

The real thing here is: saying it's sweet is ok, but you really want to say it's sweeter, or healthier. Details that they share can be compared and if in the aspects things share you also happen to think it's superior then it gives an even better case for why it's objectively better for you

Good advice, I find people tend to fall back on generic terms and easy statements when they aren't sure of themselves though. My public speaking professor worked us around this by putting us into debates and making us discuss things in a personal sense. One of the best examples of this was our communist vs democratic debate. Most students wanted to fall into the trap of "its better for everyone" but when posed with points of argument like loss of personal property and individual possessions the discussion became a more in depth look where we were forced to analyze the actual fundamentals of both ideologies and which worked and in what situations.

At quick glance, this and my other video may seem contradictory, but they aren't. Here's why:  Mentioning a school's programs/professors/courses is acceptable and how most students *should* go about their "Why us?" college essays. The lesson from the other video is simple: don't be superficial. Don't say, "Oh, this part about your college is cool" or "Oh, your school has tons of Nobel laureates." As I say in the other video, "Don't tell colleges you like them because of the fancy stuff they have."  Instead, acknowledge the *fit* between you and a school's programs. Yes, mention what the school has, BUT THEN DRAW A CONNECTION to your interests, prior work, or future goals. For example, a great way to create this connection could be to say, "I'd love to be part of XYZ Program TO FURTHER MY WORK IN _____."  If you look at the "good" examples both in this video and the other one, I touch upon the school's resources but connect them to *my* research goals.  To summarize:  1. Other video: don't be superficial. Anyone can merely *point out* the fancy facilities a school has. Your goal is to *draw a meaningful, personal connection* between a school's resources and your goals.  2. This video: don't be generic. A statement like, "Your school has world-renowned professors," could apply to *any* college. Mention details that are unique to the college the essay is for.
